intro: Hesperolinon californicum, commonly known as the California hesperolinon, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features include a taproot system and a short, branching stem. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to arid environments.
